page.title: 02THE VILLAGE SCHOOL (i)
page.content: Rosemarket School was built in 1860. There are two classrooms and five other rooms.Four of these used to be part of the old house where the schoolmaster lived. The house was made part of the school in 1978. The two classes are i) Junior class (aged 7_11) and ii) Infant class(4_6). There are 49 pupils and 2 teachers. School begins at 9.15 a.m. and finishes at 3.30 p.m. The children learn:- Maths,English,Reading,Science,Art,Comp uter Studies and lots of other things. The school has one computer. Games such as cricket and shinty are played and sports are held. School dinners are eaten in the Village Hall. They are cooked in Milford and brought in a van. Dinners cost 60p a day. Some children bring sandwiches and some eat at home.
